page.title: 16Rabbit Farming
page.content: This was started commercially in Presteigne by Mr.Garner in 1983.He has two types of{commercial rabbits: Californians and NewZealand whites, totalling about 4000- 5000 rabbits at any one time.They are raised from birth to a market weight of 5-6 lbs. In the winter,the rabbits sell at 42p per pound, in the summer at 30p per pound.They are sold to a packer (Midland County Packing Company)in Evesham for export to the continent, although the home market is expanding now. Rabbits are sensitive to stress.} During Broadheath races next to the farm,Mr.Garner lost 35 rabbits due to {noise stress.Disease}is prevented by putting the rabbits in separate wire cages and feeding once a day, and the shed is cleaned out once a month. Researched by Tara Carswell,Louisa Bennett & Sally Thomas.
